title: Brazil: Citibank Lowers Rates for Consumer Clients
summary: São Paulo - Starting May 2, Citibank will lower the interest rates it charges consumer clients on mortgage lines of credit, personal loans, revolving credit checks and vehicle financing. One of the most significant reductions will affect mortgage lines of credit, which the bank will offer at an annual rate of 8.90 percent plus reference rate.
tag-1: Brazil: Citibank Lowers Rates for Consumer Clients
tag-3: São Paulo – Starting May 2, Citibank will lower the interest rates it charges consumer clients on mortgage lines of credit, personal loans, revolving credit checks and vehicle financing. One of the most significant reductions will affect mortgage lines of credit, which the bank will offer at an annual rate of 8.90 percent plus reference rate.
tag-4: The changes affect new applications for vehicle financing, mortgage lines of credit and personal loans. In the case of revolving credit checks, the new rates will be applied to existing contracts. The rates may vary according to the client's relationship with the bank or the term and value of the contract.
tag-5: "In line with the new outlook for the Brazilian economy, with lower interest rates and loan stimulus programs, we are lowering our rates as a way to contribute to the country's economic growth," noted Leonel Andrade, head of Consumer Business at Citi Brazil, which includes Citibank and Credicard.
tag-6: The new terms for the different types of lines of credit are detailed below:
tag-7: Mortgage Line of Credit – annual 8.90 percent interest plus reference rate for loans obtained via Brazil's Housing Finance System (SFH);
tag-8: Personal Loans – monthly rates starting at 1.69 percent;
tag-9: Cheque Especial – monthly rates starting at 1.99 percent;
tag-10: Vehicle Financing – monthly rates starting at 0.99 percent.
tag-11: Citi Citi, the leading global bank, has approximately 200 million customer accounts and does business in more than 160 countries and jurisdictions. Citi provides consumers, corporations, governments and institutions with a broad range of financial products and services, including consumer banking and credit, corporate and investment banking, securities brokerage, transaction services, and wealth management.
